name: Dinner Tonight: Curried Apple and Potato Soup
description: I've had mixed results with blended soups lately. Sometimes it feels like I'm dealing with a wonderfully complex and succulent creation before it goes into the machine, and bland puréed slop afterwards. But I figured Martha Stewart could lead me...
recipeIngredient: 2 tart apples, peeled, cored and cut into 1 inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Place the butter in a large saucepan, and melt over medium heat. Toss in the shallots and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the grated ginger and curry powder and cook, stirring occasionally, for a minute.
Toss in the apples, potatoes, and salt. Pour in the chicken stock and crank the heat to medium-high. Cook until the potatoes are tender, about 12 minutes.

Process the soup with either an immersion blender or with a regular old blender. Return to the saucepan, add the cream, and season with salt and pepper. Place over medium heat and re-warm, do not bring to a boil, and serve.
